## Bio

Braden is a research assistant in the Hampton Lab at Carnegieâ€™s BSE Division in Pasadena, and is responsible for the management of data and the needs of the lab. He received his B.S. in Marine Biology from the University of California, Los Angeles, and his MSc. with Commendation in Marine Conservation from the University of Aberdeen. In graduate school, he specialized in fisheries science, advanced statistics, and scientific communication, and studied bycatch rates in the Scottish, pelagic mixed fisheries industry for his thesis. Prior to working at Carnegie, Braden was in Sacramento working on California Central Valley salmon population management and habitat restoration. He also has experience with aquatic animal husbandry, water systems maintenance, administrative coordination, and record keeping. 

He also built this website!
